result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Joseph F. Schilling was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 86 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine ($3039) is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision or any prison monies per statute.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of New Berlin Police Department.  DNA surcharge ($250) is assessed.  Costs are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision or any prison monies per statute.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of Extended Supervision.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joseph F. Schilling in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is Dismissed by Operation of Law.
Count 3 is Dismissed as a Read-In.
  
Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 4.5  Years
Initial Confinement:  18 Months
Extended Supervision:  3  Years
86 Days Credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges).

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to City of New Berlin Police Department);
FINE:  $ 3,039.00  
DNA Sample (if not already given) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute;

36  Months D/L REVOCATION
36  Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant may be transferred to Dodge - FORTHWITH
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joseph F. Schilling in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Joseph Smith.

Defense enters a Not Guilty plea to the new charge.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to only be released during business hours to report to WCS and Scram immediately after release.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
